content.question: On a certain day, an industrial plant manufactures steel at a rate modeled by <math alttext="R of t equals, 10 plus 30 e raised to the negative 0.6, t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>30</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> tons per hour, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in hours since the plant opened that day. What is the average rate at which the plant manufactures steel, in tons per hour, over the time interval <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
